page.title: 15Shopping Habits
page.content: Recently the shopping habits of Wakefield citizens have undergone change due to the growth of supermarkets and a hypermarket. Corner shops were once the focal point of local communities. A survey was conducted to show the effect of supermarkets on local shops. Of six local shope surveyed it became clear that they were now used as a stop gap measure. The supermarket had taken over as the supplier of the weekly groceries. Reasons for visiting the supermarket were generally cheaper prices and a variety of choice. Of 25 people questioned outside local shops, they gave reasons for using them as convenient, necessity and friendly service.{The days of the local shop {are numbered. }
